title: Intel Up Over 6%, on Pace for Largest Percent Increase Since January 2018 — Data Talk
text:
Intel Corporation (INTC) is currently at $55.67, up $3.44 or 6.59%

-- Would be highest close since April 25, 2019, when it closed at $57.61

-- On pace for largest percent increase since Jan. 26, 2018, when it rose 10.55%

-- Earlier Friday, Credit Suisse raised its price target on Intel to $65.00/share from $58.00 per share, Benzinga reported. Four other firms raised their price target on Intel and Northland raised its rating on Intel to outperform from market perform

-- On Thursday, Intel reported adjusted earnings of $1.42 a share, compared with $1.40 for the year-prior period. Analysts surveyed by FactSet were expecting earnings of $1.23 a share. Third-quarter revenue rose to $19.19 billion from $19.16 billion, also topping expectations

-- Currently up two consecutive days; up 7.64% over this period

-- Best two day stretch since the two days ending Oct. 26, 2018, when it rose 7.71%

-- Up 8.03% month-to-date

-- Up 18.62% year-to-date; on pace for best year since 2017, when it rose 27.27%

-- Up 21.84% from 52 weeks ago (Oct. 26, 2018), when it closed at $45.69

-- Up 28.09% from its 52 week closing low of $43.46 on June 3, 2019

-- Traded as high as $55.70; highest intraday level since April 25, 2019, when it hit $58.38

-- Up 6.64% at today's intraday high; largest intraday percent increase since Jan. 4, 2019, when it rose as much as 6.92%

-- Best performer in the DJIA today

-- Fourth best performer in the S&P 500 today

-- Most active stock in the S&P 500 today

-- Second best performer in the Nasdaq 100 today

-- Most active stock in the Nasdaq 100 today

-- Contributed 23.33 points to the DJIA so far today

All data as of 10:07:50 AM

Source: Dow Jones Market Data, FactSet

(END) Dow Jones Newswires

October 25, 2019 10:37 ET (14:37 GMT)
